definition: to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too

sentences.english: For Merkel and the German political establishment, it's the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 對於默克爾和德國的政治體制，這是兩全其美的。

sentences.english: Honor and profit lie not in one sack.
sentences.chinese: 代表榮耀，榮譽與利益自古難兩全。

sentences.english: Power efficiency and the general efficiency of spectrum-the United States can not be both loyal and filially pious.
sentences.chinese: 功率效率和頻譜效率一般不能兩全齊美。

sentences.english: Also can ease the discomfort caused by long-distance running, can be described as co-existence together beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 同時也能緩解長跑所帶來的不適，可謂兩全齊美。

sentences.english: She drawn something on paper for half of the day trying to find some way was satisfactory to both parties.
sentences.chinese: 她在紙上劃了半天，企圖找出個兩全的法子。

sentences.english: Can the region exploit its hidden treasures and keep locals happy, too?
sentences.chinese: 財富開採與民衆滿意能否兩全？

sentences.english: So, RIM could have the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 所以，RIM公司的做法是兩全其美。

sentences.english: This gift will make you both happy.
sentences.chinese: 這份禮物就能夠兩全其美。

sentences.english: Most coaches try to strike the happy medium.
sentences.chinese: 對此，大多數教練都會採取“兩全齊美”的中間路線。

definition: pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to feel the pulse (TCM)/Taiwan pr. [zhen3 mo4]
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
